intro: Eriocaulon metzianum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist environments such as swamps and pond margins. Its root system is fibrous, helping to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in wetlands. Eriocaulon metzianum plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by providing shelter and food for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
